reviewText: my favorite Wuthering Heights by far due to the amazing performance by Ralph Fiennes as Healthcliff. He IS Heathcliff as the book creates him, hard edges and all. He is amazing. Juliette Binoche also portrays KAthy perfectly. This pair of characters are both so horribly twisted that you both feel sorry for them and angry at them. This is exactly as the book makes them. Also, the costumes and art direction are excellent. This is an authentic representation of the era and the book
I did not like this movie.  The book was better.
One of my favorites. Just love it.
Not at all what I thought it would be.  Kind of confusing at times.  The angst of unrequited love really didn't come across at all.  Wouldn't recommend.
I Was so excited to find this movie  available at Amazon! One of my all time favorites very happy with my purchase

Yes, okay, I suppose it falls into the category of Penultimate Chick Flick, but the Binoche and Fiennes do a great job of bringing their characters to life.  The book Wuthering Heights seemed a bit over-the-top to me; but this movie helped tie some themes together.

Disappointed once you see original with Lawrence Olivier .also in the original they do not have children advise watch the one with Lawrence olivier first  the reason why I brought the new version was because the 2 actors are some of my favorites
This is the best edition that i have seen (1992). accurately portrays the book except for one part where they speed up hindleys funeral to an earlier point in the movie.
Fantastic love story. Passionate beyond words
This version was ok... I preferred the black and white version with Laurence Olivier.
I love this story and am partial to this particular version. The acting is superb and the cinematography is beautifully gloomy.
My favorite version of Wuthering Heights due to Ralph Fienne's performance. I remember searching for this DVD years ago when it wasn't available. Now here it is at a good price!
A Must for your video collection.
